qas.question: Who runs the public busses in Cork?
Besides busses, what kinds of public transportation are offered in Cork?

answers.text: shuttles to Cork Airport, and a park and ride facility in the south suburbs only

qas.question: What do the routes consist of?

answers.text: connect the city centre to the principal suburbs, colleges, shopping centres and places of interest

qas.question: What connects the suburbs to shopping centers and places of interest?
How many routes offer service to both Northern and Southern Ireland?
What is offered for the north suburbs?
Who runs the public colleges in Cork?
How are shuttles to Cork Airport numbered?

plausible_answers.text: the principal suburbs, colleges, shopping centres and places of interest

qas.question: What does Glanmire connect the city centre to?
What do shuttles provide to Glanmire?
What is used for transportation and only available in Midleton?

context: Public bus services within the city are provided by the national bus operator <a0_0><b6_0>Bus Éireann<b6_0/><a0_0/>. <b3_0>City routes<b3_0/> are numbered <b7_0>from 201 through to 219<b7_0/> and <a2_0>connect the city centre to <b8_0>the principal suburbs, colleges, shopping centres and places of interest<b8_0/><a2_0/>. <b4_0>Two<b4_0/> of these bus routes provide <b9_0>orbital services<b9_0/> across the Northern and Southern districts of the city respectively. Buses to the outer suburbs, such as Ballincollig, Glanmire, Midleton and Carrigaline are provided from the city's bus terminal at Parnell Place in the city centre. Suburban services also include <a1_0>shuttles to Cork Airport, and <b10_0>a <b5_0>park and ride facility<b10_0/><b5_0/> in the south suburbs only<a1_0/>.
